abstract: Britain will hold referendum before end of 2017 on whether to remain in European Union; list of eligible voters will exclude most EU citizens living in country; Prime Min David Cameron promises to negotiate 'better deal' with EU before membership vote.
lead_paragraph: The government said Monday that most European Union citizens living in Britain would not be able to cast a ballot on the country’s so-called Brexit.

headline.main: Britain to Curb Who Can Vote in E.U. Membership Referendum
headline.print_headline: His Path Clear, Cameron Readies Vote on E.U. Exit

snippet: The government said Monday that most European Union citizens living in Britain would not be able to cast a ballot on the country’s so-called Brexit.
